snippet: The German chancellor said she would support accelerating the process of admitting Turkey to the European Union if the country cooperated in dealing with the influx of migrants into Europe.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel, during news conference with Turkish Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu in Istanbul, says that she will support accelerating process for Turkey becoming member of European Union if it helps to reduce flow of refugees to Europe.
lead_paragraph: The German chancellor said she would support accelerating the process of admitting Turkey to the European Union if the country cooperated in dealing with the influx of migrants into Europe.

headline.main: Merkel Links Turkey’s E.U. Hopes to Stemming Flow of Refugees
headline.print_headline: Merkel Explicitly Links Turkey’s E.U. Hopes to Stemming Flow of Refugees

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
